Method Detail

interpolate

public final void interpolate(float[] from,
                              float[] to,
                              int componentCount,
                              float timeRatio,
                              float[] output)
Calculate an interpolated value.

The implementation of interpolate(float[], float[], int, float, float[]) of InterpolatorBase checks given arguments and then does the following.

  1. If 'timeRatio' is 0 or if 'from' and 'to' are identical, copy the content of 'from' to 'output' and return.
  2. Otherwise, if 'timeRatio' is 1, copy the content of 'to' to 'output' and return.
  3. Otherwise, call doInterpolate().

Specified by:
interpolate in interface Interpolator
Parameters:
from - The value at the start point of a given timespan. The length of the array must be equal to or greater than componentCount.
to - The value at the end point of a given timespan. The length of the array must be equal to or greater than componentCount.
componentCount - The component count of from[] and to[]. The value must be equal to or greater than 1.
timeRatio - A time ratio. It must be in between 0.0 and 1.0.
output - A place into which the calculated value is put. The length of the array must be equal to or greater than componentCount.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException -
  • 'timeRatio' is less than 0.
  • 'timeRation' is greater than 1.
  • 'componentCount' is less than 1.
  • 'output' is null.
  • The length of 'output' is less than 'componentCount'.
  • 'from' is null (this check is not done if 'timeRatio' is 0).
  • The length of 'from' is less than 'componentCount' (this check is not done if 'timeRatio' is 0).
  • 'to' is null (this check is not done if 'timeRatio' is 1).
  • The length of 'to' is less than 'componentCount' (this check is not done if 'timeRatio' is 1).

doInterpolate

protected abstract void doInterpolate(float[] from,
                                      float[] to,
                                      int componentCount,
                                      float timeRatio,
                                      float[] output)
